understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method called prevalentSystem() which checks if a variable _prevalentSystem is null and throws an IllegalStateException if it is.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration in the sense that it is checking for the presence of a configured prevalent system. If the prevalent system is not configured, it throws an exception indicating that it must be configured before proceeding.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _prevalentSystem is used in the code to initialize a GenericSnapshotManager with the prevalent system, snapshot serializers, directory, and journal serializer. It checks if a null snapshot manager exists, if not, it creates a new PrevaylerDirectory and initializes the GenericSnapshotManager with the necessary parameters.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration _prevalentSystem is triggered whenever the snapshot serializers are not empty, which means it is triggered when a new GenericSnapshotManager needs to be created with the specified parameters.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the configuration option _prevalentSystem is that it affects the creation and management of snapshots in the system. Depending on the parameters passed to the GenericSnapshotManager, it can impact the size and efficiency of snapshot management in the system.
